text: These guys are AMAZING! They are extremely knowledgeable about all of the products they sell and the services they offer. The shop is set up to handle any and all off road performance needs that anyone can have. It is very easy for me to say that after my experience with this wonderful group of gentleman that I will never go anywhere to buy tires again. I was impressed enough with them that my search for a Jeep to build is in high gear now. I'm looking forward to seeing what they can do with it. The best advice I can give to everyone is to check them out for any and all tire needs.

text: This is the best shop around, I am fairly new to Off-roading and building a vehicle to do it in. Josh, Devin, and Paul have all been extremely helpful and informative. Devon helped out anytime I called to follow up on when parts where coming in along with the progress during the day of install. Paul man this guy is the one you want looking over labor, he is very OCD about getting it right and not cutting corners and has a wealth of knowledge. Additionally all the staff at Elite are very professional and will answer any question you have, if they can’t answer it then they will make sure they get you the answer with some digging. I will maintain being a happy customer with a trusted shop which is hard to find. I can’t wait to do future building with the Elite family! Oh by the way check out all their social media and advertisements they are top notch!

text: These guys are very transparent and polite. The turn around time was quicker than anticipated. Most importantly, they’re honest and do excellent work. I will not hesitate to use them in the future for vehicle needs and wants.

name: Grant Johnson
text:
Recently bought a new to me Jeep TJ. I couldn’t even drive it home (15 mins away from place of purchase) due to death wobble, loose steering wore out track bar and a laundry list of other issues. I had little to no hope for getting the vehicle street worthy and planned on just keeping it as a dedicated trailer rig. I called Elite and spoke with Josh over the phone, he said they can get it fixed up and back on the road.

They absolutely blew my expectations with the work put in on my jeep. They replaced all heim joints on the steering and track bar as well as completed a full inspection on the vehicle torque checking all nuts and bolts under the vehicle my peace of mind. They even found a few more issues that were fixed in shop for safety reasons on this inspection.

The whole process was seamless from drop off to pickup. Communication was top notch on any issue they ran into along the way. I will absolutely be returning to get my truck leveled with wheels and tires in the near future. Awesome job and awesome company. ⭐️ 12/10stars ⭐️

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review Grant glad we could get your Jeep back drivable!

resp.text: Thank you Allen we look forward to working with you more!

resp.text: Glad we could help you make it happen!

name: M O
text: Rip off.. took my Yukon in for an alignment they called and said it was ready. Then told me 119bucks payed they handed me my keys then said oh BTW we couldn't do the alignment it needed new tie rod end inners and ball joints. And said the amount I payed was for the inspection.. I didn't want an inspection but a alignment. So I took the yukon home and replaced all the parts to find out it was fine. Only had alittle play in upper right ball joint the mechanic is a joke only trying to fill his pockets this is why you can't trust auto shops.  Stay away because you are gonna get ripped off!!.  I Am Mike Overton and I Approve This Message!!!

resp.text:
Hey Mike Overton we are sorry you feel this way but we did not perform an alignment due to worn out suspension and steering components. You getting charged was a mistake by your sales person which was corrected and you were given a refund. We pride ourselves in quality work we do not change for a service we cannot perform any other shop would have performed an “Alignment” and not let you know about any front end issues and charged you.

Thanks,
Josh Balch

text: The guys at Elite went above and beyond helping me get my Gladiator sorted. Solid advice, never tried to up sell, and was fast to respond.  Great communication even before I let them know I was going to use them.  Solid group of guys.  I have dealt with a few of the more popular off road shops in town and this was by far my best experience

name: Ken Osvath
text:
Highly recommend.  Thanks once again to Elite Offroad And Performance!  We’ve had great experiences working with Josh and Alex.

Previously EOP had stayed late waiting for a towed Jeep arrival when our son’s track bar mount broke, rendering it un-drivable.

They fixed it in a timely and cost-effective manner, installing a new adjustable track bar and Teraflex front lower adjustable control arms which significantly improved drive quality.

Then recently I swung by and picked up a HIKEit X9 Throttle Controller for my Jeep, from Alex, as a cost-effective performance upgrade.

OMG!  What a difference!   Just as EOP advertised — it’s easy of use, adjustable Throttle Response with 36 settings within its 4-driving modes (Cruise, Sport, Race, Eco/4x4 Crawl) and Auto mode that adjusts dynamically to your driving along with Anti-Theft Password Protected Pedal Lock.   Thanks EOP!

I had to re-order the alternator and I have to wait until Monday after Christmas before I can get the truck fixed. This is only the most recent issue from this store I've experienced. Please, can someone hire a more competent employee....  UPDATE ... I called again on Monday after Christmas and was told that they ordered a starter by mistake. I  can not believe the incompetence of the employees here.

It seems that the responder to this post has also failed to pay attention. Is this a company wide incompetence? In the future I would suggest using other automotive parts dealers. No, i have not gotten the alternator yet. But I do hope the other store i ordered from has the correct part. I am planning on picking it up today.

name: Tom Stofer
text: I went to the Dadeville, AL, AutoZone Auto Parts store on Monday, Jan. 6, to purchase a battery for my lawn tractor. They had the battery I wanted but the shelf date was several months old. I asked a store employee if their batteries were routinely rotated and he said they were. The employee further told me that their delivery truck would be there on Wednesday. He seemed to indicate the truck would bring newer dated batteries. I left my name and number but never got a call. The following Monday I visited the store again and spoke to the same employee. He checked and said they didn't get any newer batteries in. He said he was going to the Alexander City store that afternoon and would see if they had a newer battery. He again said he would call me either way and let me know. I confirmed that he still had the note with my name and number. And again he never called. I sent an email to AutoZone's national website regarding their lack of customer service. They replied and said that my email was being forwarded to the district manager and that I would be contacted within 24 to 48 hours. That didn't happen either. I sent a second email to AutoZone letting them know that the district manager never contacted me. They said my second email was also forwarded to the district manager.A day or two later the district manager finally attempted to contact me. But by then I had already purchased a battery at O'Rielly's Auto Parts where, I must say, I received much better customer service.

resp.text: This is not the impression we want to leave, Tom. We're disappointed to hear you did not have a great experience with our team. We strive to help you in any way we can with your automotive needs. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We are always improving and hope you give us another chance to win back your trust and confidence.

name: Cyndie Downer
text: My husband had his truck windows tinted here. They are 40 minutes from where we live, but highly recommended by a friend. Great experience, it was quick, under an hour and it looked great. So we schedule my car for the 1st available appt., a couple of months away. No problem. My husband wasn't able to pay deposit over the phone that day - somekind of trouble with payment system. Female told my husband no problem, we were a repeat customer. Morning of 1 pm appointment I call to confirm time only to find my appointment had been cancelled because a deposit wasn't paid and they had already scheduled another for that time slot. She said he (her husband?) tried contacting me the day before but I had just swapped to a new phone -and my voice mail wasn't set up yet. Next available appt.was in May. I just tell her I'll reschedule, or find another place to have it done. She offered to call if there was a cancellation.  My husband calls them and reminds her that she said the deposit issue was okay. She admits she didn't make a note of it and they can get me in. I take my lunch hour and an extra hour (or so) off from work, drive 40 minutes one way, then when I say I'll just wait while it's being done, he says that it will take 3-4 hours for my sedan. I based my timeline on our previous experience (<1 hour) and we were NOT told on any of the three phone calls leading up to the appointment to expect a 3-4 hour window! They even knew I was driving from 40 minutes away. I am not bashing this business, I am just sharing my experience. You can call this a series of mis-communications and odd events but I call it just poor customer service. We will never do business here again.

resp.text: I'm very sorry for the mix up and your disappointing  experience during your visit.  We tried very hard to accommodate you and were very thankful to the customer who allowed us to open your spot back up. We did not realize that you were expecting your car to be done in the same amount of time as the smaller job we did on your husband's truck. This was a series of unfortunate events for both of us. I hope that you were able to get your sedan tinted and all went well.

name: Donnie Coleman
text:
Filed on : January 30 2014

Filed by :
Donald Coleman
359 South Montcrest
Cullman AL 35057

Filed against :
Stewart Auto Supply, Inc.
1211 Loring Nw
Cullman AL 35055

Complaint Description:
worst machine work i have seen in my life ,and the machinist is rude and not willing to make things right. Took my 6.0 LQ4 block, crank and heads to have them reworked, cleaned and check to see if they were still within spec limits. We discussed engine gaskets rebuild kits. I left and then called on the phone to discuss more pricing and gaskets again. I went back to stewarts to bring some more parts to be cleaned but on that visit talked again about rebuild kits and gaskets. Now each time i talked to the owner about the gasket sets i asked, were they felpro? his answer every time was yes they will be felpro. He gave me a price which was little more then what i had search online for but i decided to go with his kit since the gaskets were definitely felpro . well is snowed the next day and roads were closed so i had to wait another day for him to finish. roads were still bad so he came in late but he was finished around lunch time. So when i get there to pick up my parts i ask where is the rebuild kit. The machinist shows me the box and the gaskets sets are not felpro, they are Victor reins gaskets. I refused to buy the kit because he told me a they would contain felpro. The machinist told me that felpro and victor reins were made by the same company that they were the exact same gaskets. That was his first lie too me. Those are two entirely different companys, with different pricing and materials. so we deducted the kit and now i owe for the machine work done, which is 345.00 I pay the balance go home and start unloading the block and notice the cam bearing that they installed for me were damaged from the installation too. Took it back and the owner said he doesn't know any other way to put those bearings in. well duh!!! but you don't damage them when they go in , if you do damage them then you take them out and install new ones. but they sent me home with that crap. so i decided to look over the heads real good since things are already not good. well the heads are aluminum heads , they look as if someone took a wire brush to clean the mating surfaces on the heads. they are scratched badly. there are several scratches going across the from one cylinder to the other which will leak when it is installed back on the block. So i took the heads back to stewarts this morning and asked to talk to someone about this and the owner wasn't there but the machinist was. so i showed the head to the machinist and asked what he did to it. he said he milled it. i asked is that acceptable? he said yes. i asked if he could show me any where in writing, online or any mechanic that can tell me that those scratches on the mating surface of the head was acceptable .The machinist looked at me and said pick my head up and get the hell out of there. You can imagine what my response was. :) but I'm not happy with this and the place of business is just horrible. I have been building engines for over 23 years and i have never seen anyone tell me that scratches on a aluminum head was acceptable to install. They refused to take of this and now i have to take the heads and have them resurfaced if they can even be resurfaced again. i also heve to take the block and crank to another machine shop to have them check and correct everything stewarts touched. BEWARE SHOTTY WORK AND BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. STAY AWAY if you want good work performed.

Your Desired Resolution:
At this point all i want is a complete refund for the services they performed. I tried to go back to talk to them and i was told to get the hell out of their store. The work performed was bad and i don't fell comfortable letting them touch anything else of mine.

text: Went in to get a replacement antenna for my car March 3rd 2021! When I went to check out the guy at the register was talking to a guy who just walked in and asked where the wheel covers were and he walked over a showed him! Instead of coming back to check me out he stood there talking when I ask him to check me out he ignored me and kept talking. This guy looked like a school kid and was very rude! I will not be going to the Sylacauga store again! I'll go to Cbu e.g. or take my business to another parts store!

resp.text: This is not the impression we want to leave, David. We'd appreciate it if you emailed us at customer.reviews@autozone.com so we can learn more about your experience and get back on track. We want to make sure all of our customers feel welcome and valued at our store, and it seems like we let you down. We hope you give us another chance to provide a great customer experience.

name: Rachel Lee
text:
Gave an extra start because whoever answered the phone had the decency to accept fault for an issue, and was polite.

Placed order online, and received an email that the order is ready for pickup. So, I drove from C'burg (past the AutoZone that said they are out of stock online) to Sylacauga, only to be told that the parts I ordered were not in stock, despite the notification that they WERE in stock.

Rather than calling me and letting me know, they issued a refund. Refund will take 3 to 5 business days to hit my card. I'm down to a couple dollars in the bank, I used my last bit of money for parts to fix a car for work.

Had they actually called me and let me know it's not in stock and not to make the drive, I would have requested they order the parts and I'd come pick them up tomorrow. But now, I'm broke for the next week. I can't even order the parts.

Please, PLEASE Autozone, next time this happens to someone, call them IMMEDIATELY and let them know, and ask them if they'd prefer a refund or to order the parts. Your customer should decide what should be done with their money.

resp.text: We're sorry for the inconvenience, Rachel. Professionalism is a priority for us, so we're sorry we weren't able to let you know. We strive to keep our stores well-stocked with a wide selection of products to support your automotive needs and get you back on the road. We're continuously improving and we hope you check us out again.

I just needed some direction and what I got was a "we can't help you".  I went down the street to NAPA auto parts where the guy working in there checked my fuse for me and replaced it for me.  Advance needs to take some customer service lessons from NAPA.
I very rarely write negative reviews for retail businesses because I worked in retail management for years and I understand that things happen but this was beyond rude and I will always use NAPA going forward.

name: Dorothy Adams
text: I asked the young gentleman at the Counter if they helped replace headlight bulbs. He said depends on the car- so he came and checked it out. Help me find the bulb that was needed, replaced in no time! He had me check my high beams and low beams- said all four of headlights were working- (it took him a second) though to say that. (That should have been a red flag right then for me).Well I gave him a small tip for helping me out. I went to leave and looking at the lights shining on the door it did not look like all four were working but I had somewhere else to be and was already running behind. I said I would check it out when I got to my next stop- sure enough they were not working. I am mad at myself for not addressing it then! I called back the next morning and talked to the young man and he said “all four were working when you were here.” I explained how the minute he walked away- I didn’t think it was right but it’s my fault for not addressing it right then! I am supposed to stop by and see the manager today— so we shall see what the outcome is! Lesson learned for me!

resp.text: This is not the impression we should leave, Dorothy. It is never our intent to deceive or mislead as we value all our customers. Please send us an email at customer.reviews@autozone.com so we can make things right. We hope we can regain your trust and confidence.

name: Trevor Joiner
text: Advance Auto is my go-to store for all things automotive. Tonight, I visited not for automotive needs but guitar needs. I'm a luthier (I build, repair, and restore guitars) and tonight I needed a fine polish to restore the gloss to the lacquer of an old 70s guitar. They didn't have what I was looking for (Meguire's Mirror Glaze #9) but the guy was super, super helpful and friendly. The friendly service, competitive prices, and amazing savings when using coupons for online purchases are why I will come to Advance again and again.

text: I ordered online and went inside for pickup. All the workers were polite and helpful. I didn't have to wait long to get what I had order, and they even help me find a tool I wasn't able to find on the website!

name: Michaela Carter
text: I went in to get an oil filter for my car and told them exactly what I needed. Well the lady rang up the wrong filter and I didn’t recognize it til I paid and picked up the bag and it was way to heavy. I told her that was the wrong one we got it corrected. I paid almost $18 for that and I knew the one I normally get is only around $10-11. So she gets the receipt and is scanning it to refund the difference and i thought it was completed so as I am walking out I check the receipt and nothing was refunded. I go to the back double check the pricing before saying anything went to the front to advise her there was nothing refunded. She proceeded to tell me that I seemed to be in a hurry so she was going to let me go ahead and go but in order to refund the difference I had to swipe my card again. So if you have anything with a price difference to be refunded make sure it actually happens and you get the receipt.

resp.text: Michaela, we apologize for the lack of attention regarding your whole visit to our Muscle Shoals location. Your feedback has been forwarded to the Field Leadership team of this store and they will address any additional training that may be needed. When you come in with exact details of what you want, that should be what you get. We hope that that you do give the store another chance in the future to provide you the proper experience. Thank you for shopping with Advance Auto Parts.

resp.text: Hello Kevin, thank you for taking the time to leave this review! Here at Advance, we aim to provide exceptional service to all of our customers, and we're sorry to learn that your visit to our Muscle Shoals location resulted in a 1 star rating. Unfortunately, we cannot offer installation of headlight bulbs, however we do provide this service for wiper blades. We did make contact with this store, and unfortunately they were unfamiliar with this incident. We certainly apologize for any inconveniences this may have caused you, and hope for another opportunity to earn your business. Thank you for shopping with Advance Auto Parts and Batteries, we look forward to seeing you again!

name: Rick
text: There are several things that make this place the best.  I write this review after driving an hour and a half to do business with them.  First off all, they do more than trucks.  30 inch rims for your car they do it, headlights, taillights, lifts, flares, tonneau covers, etc... if you want it they can get it.  There prices are hard to beat.  But let me talk about what sets them apart from everyone besides their exceptional pricing.  From the moment you walk in you are treated with respect and that they are glad to see you there.  They listen very intently to what you want whether in person or on the phone.  This is missed by so many other places.  They go through getting prices as well as can show you options.  They do this to make sure you get exactly what you want for the best price.  While doing so they take notes on the conversation to ensure they don't have to ask you several times because they forgot.  Making sure they stay on top of it and making everything move flawless.  The business is very well maintained and the showroom is definitely a showroom, not just a display, spotless.  Respect and honesty is projected so loudly by the staff, you will feel like its your own family that runs the business.  I can't say enough about this because I have been there a few times for different purchases and  the entire staff is friendly as well as great to interact with.  As I return to them next week to make another purchase, driving an hour and a half versus using the internet, I know I am meeting people who are like family, getting the best price, the right part, quality parts, but also the best service that I have seen in the state.

name: KJ MullinZ
text:
🔥Workers involved:
MIKE (Store Manager)
THOMAS D. (Employee)
Date of incident: 2/20/21 - 4:30-5:00pm.

🔥Bought a refurbished starter from there a few years ago. Returned it because it went bad and had a warranty. Did not want to deal with another refurbished starter, so I requested a brand new one. Was told they cannot get a brand new one which is fine. So they told me I could return the defective refurbished starter I had for a refund so I can use that refund on buying a new starter from another store. At that time, that particular employee was real helpful and kind to me.

Then the incident on 2/20/21 happened when I returned on that date with my defective starter. was dealing with the store manager Mike and his employee Thomas D. at the time. I was told that the starter needed to test bad in order for me to get a refund which is fine, because I had my mechanic test the starter beforehand and I recorded a video as evidence. After waiting a good few minutes because it seemed like something was wrong with the machine, the store manager Mike comes out and says that the starter tested good, but that he would still honor the refund. I told him that's fine, but the starter should have tested bad because my mechanic already tested it and I watched him test it, so I pretty much told Mike that the machine is to blame, then he got defensive and rude with his tone of voice about the machine clearly stating that the machine was not incorrect. To avoid further debating, I directly said to just do the refund. His attitude regarding the situation was unprofessional and unacceptable.

What makes the situation even worse is the fact that the employee Thomas D. asked me for my driver's license on returning the defective starter which should not have happened, because I have my receipt. When I asked him why he's asking for my driver's license, he said they were supposed to do that on returns, but that's obviously not true. Something didn't feel right, so I called another advance Auto parts store about the situation and that store told me that advance auto of Enterprise were in the wrong for taking my driver's license. My driver's license has the address to my Mother's home because it's an old address and I am not comfortable with that address being on file because I'm protective of my mother and concerned for her safety. I do not trust people I don't know, and I definitely do not trust that advance Auto parts store anymore and ever again.

They acted very shady and I felt discriminated because I'm part Asian. I've been shopping there off and on for years for myself and for my Mother. As of now, I am no longer a customer and I want my information out of that system immediately. Yes, I got my refund, but I shouldn't have had to go through that much trouble to get it, or feel that uncomfortable. Everything that happened that day was pretty much recorded on my phone along with two eyewitnesses that were with me in case I need them for future reference.

resp.text: Hello KJ, thank you for leaving your comments about your visit to our Enterprise location. We have forwarded your concerns to the store leadership and apologize for the experience you had. In no way does Advance Auto condone discrimination and we will be investigating the allegations. Please feel free to reach out to our customer service department at 877-238-2623 to provide any more information and thank you for choosing Advance Auto.

Then the next day, the grouchy old guy ringing us up for the correct parts, refused to give me my military discount, even though I had my VA card, and had mentioned it before he finished the transaction! For crying out loud, it was applied to the first purchase, that was returned because they were the wrong dang parts! I'm sorry, but after my third visit to this store, I'll drive to the fairhope store, Foley store, or Robertsdale store before I'll go to this store ever again, it was as bad as the one in Mobile.

name: Josh Waldeck
text:
The guys at Jimmy's are fantastic - I didn't want a fancy setup or any crazy speakers/subwoofers - I was just looking for a subtle smartphone enabled stereo for an 08 Acura.

They gave me the range of options available without being pushy to get me to buy some extravagant device. They knew my goal and helped me find an audio system that matched.

Ultimately, they did an outstanding job at installing a subtle double din Sony XAV AX5000. The integration looks OEM and the backup camera is extremely subtle with a crystal clear image. I was really worried about an aftermarket setup looking tacky, but these guys did a very professional job.

Highly recommend the team at Jimmy's. (before and after pics posted, along with the backup camera)

name: Kevin Wall
text:
These are the guys to use for all your car and marine stereo needs!!!!

Long story short: The marina that the Cobalt is stored at forces you to use their vendor. After a simple upgrade from factory set up I had multiple issues with the stereo system.

Took to the original marina I purchased the boat from to fix. Returned with a bill and bunch of excuses and no fix just a misdiagnosis.

Called the team from Jimmy's to sort out. They accommodated a time that worked for me to bring the boat in.

In a few short minutes had an initial diagnosis. Three short hours later they had fixed all issues and made the system work exactly as designed.

Extremely reasonable charge to perform the work!

If you need a stereo upgrade for your boat go here first!

If you are stuck at a marina with no way to get to them, talk to your marina manager to let the team at Jimmy's come to your boat. You'll be glad you did!

See you on the water!

name: Leonard Hall
text:
I tried, on many occasions, to support this business. I went here in June and spoke with Ben about correcting an issue that was caused at another car audio place.

Ben assured me that it would be an easy fix and told me to come by the following week. I called one day that next week and Ben said that they were too busy on that particular day. I asked if I could just make an appointment instead. Ben said, “Well, I’m kinda tied up right now. Try us again later this week.”

I was in the area the following week so I went by. After greeting me, Ben remembered me and immediately told me that they couldn’t get to my car that day. I told him that I wasn’t expecting a same-day service. I, instead, wanted to make an appointment. Ben thanked me for coming by and told me that the shop had been so busy.

He, again, assured me that the shop could easily correct the problem. He went on to say, “It’s really a five-minute fix. I could do it now, but I don’t want to just in case something happens and makes it longer than that and throw our day off.”

My appointment was set for Wednesday, July 8th at 9:30am. I used PTO at work so that I could finally get the issue taken care of. The evening before my appointment, Ben called and told me they would have to cancel (not reschedule) my appointment because they didn’t get a chance to finish a car from the previous day. He went on to say that they could probably do it at “some other time” and he’d call me to let me know when. Of course, I was never called.

•Why would you tell your customer that you’re too busy to give them an appointment? Especially when there are others working in the office.

•Why are you making the customer chase you as if this is the only place that could correct the issue?

•I understand that the shop may have been busy, or behind schedule. Why not reschedule my appointment?

•If you did not want to (or could not) perform the work, you should’ve been upfront. It was a waste of both of our time.

This is the second Jimmy’s Car Stereo location I’ve had a poor experience at.

text: The employees here are very kind and helpful, I was wanting to get my system installed, I had everything you needed including the wires, I just needed it put in, I got quoted $229 at a place I was looking at before I decided to use Jimmys, when I called Jimmy’s they quoted me at $150, this being the most I would pay, needless to say their prices are very good, also I dropped my car off at 9 and it was ready by 11:45, I dropped it off on a Friday and it was very busy but they still found the time to get my system installed very fast, I recommend jimmys to anyone who is interested.

name: Neil Sasser
text: Awesome service!! Will do the job when others won’t and will do it fast!!

name: David Williams
text: I was told that it would be two or more weeks before I can get system check or replace so I took business to the car stereo shop and got fix up the same day

name: Patrick Holder
text: Jimmys’ auburn location did a full audio system replacement for my 4runner about a year ago and I have since returned to have my lights upgraded to LED bulbs. Honest service and the work is always done in a timely manner, so Jimmy’s is my go to place for car audio and electronics.

name: It’s me
text: I’m had some work done a couple years ago and it has been great so far. My only gripe is how tight they tightened my positive battery terminal. Long story short, in my attempt to remove the battery, I stripped the terminal and grounded out my wrench simultaneously which caused more problems with the wiring that I had to pay a mechanic to fix. All of this could have been easily avoided if they wouldn’t have tightened it SO TIGHT! Completely unnecessary, especially considering how close the fuse box and the battery are put together which already makes it hard enough to losen. I would have rather used that money I spent on a mechanic at Jimmy’s getting more audio equipment because they have great stuff.

name: Cynthia Jackson
text: The service was great and the wait time minimum. A couple of necessary items for installation was added to my purchase but after the installation started, I was notified immediately that those items were not needed and received a credit on my purchase. For good honest service and great prices, I recommend Jimmy Car Stereo.

text: The new owner is great. He has turned the shop around. Better installers and customer service. I worked there for a while before Jimmy passed and it was chaos. And The car stereo shop there competitor is terrible and overpriced and lies about their warranty .  spent like 4000 bucks in 6 months and eas sold a 600 dollar amp that didnt work they wouldnt return it like i did it and i have more experience then their whole team. text: This place has the worst customer service ever.   Been trying to get an estimate for 3 weeks now.  told them i wasnt able to come up.  Sent text and pics of what i wanted.  The manager acted like he wasnt interested  in helping.  This place blows.

name: Sara Holland
text:
Terrible, installed a cd player in my vehicle, if u push ever so slightly on the buttons it turns off. Didn't ensure that the cd player was mounted correctly.  It moves around easily.
Also installed 2subs (10in) and gave me a puny little punch amp (rock/fos). Barely powered a door speaker.
They just want your money as quick as possible and get you out the door.

Oh!
And also wired my husbands door speakers to an amp. Wiring so bad if you move the wire at all it cuts out.

We love music and we love to have our sound in our vehicles. Was willing to spend whatever, but they still fkd us over.
They have no business being in this business.

Do yourself a favor and call around and go to anyone but these guys.

Best Buy does a better job than JCS.
